planning_constraints.heritage: no heritage listings but high local attachment

land_value_logic.venue_benefit: anchoring cultural identity boosts place value
land_value_logic.risk_management: phased delivery reduces upfront financial exposure

developer.name: Developer (British Land JV)
developer.description: Represents the joint venture leading the Canada Water masterplan.
developer.objective: Ensure the financial viability of the multi-decade project by adapting to market shifts, managing risk, and maintaining investor confidence.
developer.influence: Significant financial backing, planning expertise, and direct control over the development.

resident_homeowner.name: Long-Term Homeowner
resident_homeowner.description: A resident who has owned property in the area for many years.
resident_homeowner.objective: Protect property values, peace, and quiet. Wary of noise and crowding from new venues and increased density.
resident_homeowner.influence: Represents a vocal community group, has local political connections.

resident_social.name: Social Housing Resident
resident_social.description: A resident living in social or affordable housing within or near the redevelopment zone.
resident_social.objective: Fight against any reduction in affordable housing. Concerned about displacement and gentrification.
resident_social.influence: Strong moral argument, support from community activists and some councillors.

potential_buyer.name: Potential Buyer / Investor
potential_buyer.description: Represents the target market of young professionals and investors looking to buy new homes in the area.
potential_buyer.objective: Wants a vibrant, high-amenity area with strong cultural identity and good investment potential.
potential_buyer.influence: Represents market demand, which is crucial for the developer's sales strategy.

community_activist.name: Community Activist
community_activist.description: An advocate for anti-gentrification, cultural democracy, and inclusive development.
community_activist.objective: Ensure the development benefits the existing community, not just new arrivals. Wary of 'arts-washing' and privately controlled public spaces.
community_activist.influence: Mobilizes public opinion, scrutinizes developer promises, and organizes protests.

council_planner.name: Council Planner / Councillor
council_planner.description: An elected official or planner from Southwark Council, responsible for ensuring the plan is compliant and fair.
council_planner.objective: Balance legal compliance (e.g., affordable housing floors), electoral accountability, and the long-term success of the neighbourhood.
council_planner.influence: Regulatory power, political accountability, and the final say on planning approval.

urban_designer.name: Urban Designer / Architect
urban_designer.description: A professional focused on the quality of the public realm, massing, and placemaking.
urban_designer.objective: Promote a high-quality, walkable, and coherent public realm with active ground floors and well-integrated open spaces.
urban_designer.influence: Technical expertise and design standards that influence the planning committee's decisions.

micro_events.text: Viability Shock: A new report shows construction inflation has spiked, putting the project's financial model under severe pressure.
Noise Petition: A group of long-term homeowners has organized a petition against the proposed cultural venue, citing noise and traffic concerns.
Arts Funding Boost: A national arts body offers a surprise grant for the cultural venue, increasing its prestige and potential.
Affordable Housing March: Social housing residents and community activists stage a march demanding the council protect affordable housing quotas.
Investor Sentiment Dip: A financial news outlet reports that young professionals are becoming wary of the area due to the ongoing disputes.
Council Policy Change: The borough unexpectedly revises its local plan, raising the minimum affordable housing floor for large schemes from 35% to 40%.
